title: They’re going to build a $7 billion city where?
text:
Email a friend 
WORK is set to begin on a massive new “tourist” city. 
But there’s a twist — it’s being built by a place that’s rolling in riches, but they’re doing it on another continent. 
A Dubai-based developer has signed a 4.5-billion euro ($7 billion) contract to build the sprawling city in Bosnia, which has become a magnet for investment from the United Arab Emirates (UAE). 
Buroj Property Development plans to build thousands of homes, several hotels, a shopping mall and a hospital in the municipality of Trnovo at the foot of Bjelasica, one of four mountains surrounding the capital Sarajevo. 
It’s an unprecedented luxury property scheme for the area, and Buroj Chief Executive Ismail Ahmed says it’s the largest real estate investment in eastern Europe. Villa Lake in Buroj Ozone. Picture: Buroj Property Development 
Work on the complex, which will cover an area of 1.3 million square metres, is set to begin in April next year. A three-bedroom villa will cost $358,000. 
“This is my life project and I hope that we will finish it without delay”, Mr Ahmed said at the signing ceremony. Bakir Izetbegović, chairman of the Bosnia-Herzegovina presidency, and Buroj chief executive, Ismail Ahmed. Picture: Buroj Property Development 
“I sincerely believe in this because I am convinced that Bosnia is an important global tourist destination that has yet to be discovered,” he said. — Buroj Property Dubai (@BurojProperty1) February 12, 2015 
The Balkans country of 3.8 million people, 40 per cent of whom are Muslims, has registered a significant increase in visitors from Gulf states such as UAE, Qatar and Saudi Arabia in recent years. The incredible shopping centre. Picture: Buroj Property Development 
While project agreements were signed earlier this year, the scale of the investment has increased hugely in the last few days. 
The “tourist city” is the latest in a series of large property projects by Gulf companies. 
A tourist resort built by a Kuwaiti investor around 30 kilometres from Sarajevo is scheduled to open on Saturday. 
Elsewhere, a Saudi company is building a new residential area comprising more than 200 villas in the hills of Sarajevo. 
The project is slated for completion by the end of 2016. 
— With AAP
